channel.description: Partition Information (MBR and GPT) Partition information is stored on the disk in a small region. Read by the operating system at boot time. Master Boot Record (MBR) on the BIOS-based systems GUID Partition Table (GPT) on the UEFI-based systems. At system boot, the BIOS/UEFI: scans all storage devices, detects the presence of MBR/GPT areas, identifies the boot disks, loads the bootloader program in memory from the default boot disk, executes the boot code to read the partition table and identify the /boot partition, loads the kernel in memory, and passes control over to it. MBR and GPT store disk partition information and the boot code. Master Boot Record (MBR) Resides on the first sector of the boot disk.
